Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2012 02:17PM hydeskate wrote: Just a thought I have the same problem off and on come to find out part of the problem was light from outside and the light from the tv was keeping me up, which is funny becasue before cancer I had to have TV to fall asleep  I got black out curtains for my room, it helped with getting to REM but I still have bouts of little to no sleep.   I get to the point I exhaust myself inorder to sleep, which isn't very smart, but I find doing a hobby I like reading, writing building models to keep my mind of stress of work or the fact I have Stage IV, helps in the sleep department.
Posts.Title: Just me again. Still sad, scared and now absolutey exhausted julie26 pallir

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2011 09:53PM hydeskate wrote: I have only lost mine once, so far and had a wig that lasted half-day, I went bald.  I would wear hats or Under Armour skull caps when I worked soccer games outside so my head didn't get burnt.   Kinda funny I had to get my driver license renewed right after I lost all my hair, so I am bald in the pic and now have hair, and its like 4 more years before I get to take another pic.
Posts.Title: How many times have you lost your hair? CoolBreeze kajsa

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2012 10:28PM hydeskate wrote: I got my liver biopsy and port installed at the same time, went in around 9am and was in the car and on the way home by noon.  Come to find out they let me go before the doctor's could give me my info packet for my port and what to do, I got a call at 3pm as I was on my way home from Target the nurse giving me cleaning and bandage instructions and said she would mail the info.
Posts.Title: Ever had a liver biopsy? llanabeth SPAMgirl

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2012 08:04AM hydeskate wrote: I am @ 4 years with liver/lung METS dx right out of the gate with stage IV Triple Negative, going on 2.5 years of being on a Chemo Break and NED.
Posts.Title: Long term with liver mets? mkkjd60 soleil505

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2012 03:11PM hydeskate wrote: Linda-n3ypb- My doctors declared me NED after a full year of all my scans coming back "clean" meaning all the spots they found when I was dx where gone and no cancer could be seen by the CT Scan and PET.   They where actually stunned when the first scan came back after Christmas 08 and the big stubborun spot on my liver was gone, the where planning on using a cyberknife on it.(I have triple negative breast cancer) I was off Chemo from Jan 09 to July 09 for a bmx and radiation, scans continued to be clean, but they decided to give me more Chemo for the Hell of it @ the high dose possible of Abraxane from Aug 09 to Oct 09.  I now get scanned every 3 months while I am battling the stupid autoimmune disorder that I inherited along with the BRAC 1 gene.
Posts.Title: Long term with liver mets? mkkjd60 soleil505

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2012 05:43AM hydeskate wrote: Apparently I haven't been counting right I was dx in 2008 with Stage IV Triple NEgative Breast Cancer with METS in my liver and lungs.  Got my 3 month check-up yesterday and my Doc said you do realize you have been NED for 4 years, she chuckled because apparently the TNBC expert at the hospital had emailed her that day about what my next Chemo would be, she laughed guess I got to email her back and tell her your still NED. Everyone case is different but there is always hope that the doctors find the right cocktail for an individual.  My case is unique becasue I was dx with an autoimmune disorder Sjogren's shortly after my Chemo Holiday began,  the doctor's believe that is what is holding my cancer at bay, so I am now be watched for the cancer and treated for the Sjogren's which is also incureable but treatable.  It has been kicking my but causing all kinds of havac but it looks like we may have got the right combo of pain pills and meds to control the dryness, fatigue and joint pain. My next scan will be December 4th.
Posts.Title: Long term with liver mets? mkkjd60 soleil505

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2012 09:15PM hydeskate wrote: When I was dx 2008 out of the gate with Stage IV, I was on Abraxane alone which got all my cancer except one spot in my liver.  I then went to AC red devil) as a stand alone that got the one spot left in the liver, putting my NED, after surgery and rads, I had another round of Abraxane for the fun of it, I was still NED.  My last Abraxane treatment was Oct 2009, currently on a 3 year 2 month chemo sabbatical,  no need to worry I got dx with an auto immunne disorder after my immune system came back online to keep the doctors busy and scratching there head.
Posts.Title: Abraxane alone? marywh soleil505

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2012 04:38PM hydeskate wrote: I decided to have fun with it and allowed one of the college athletic teams I work daily with cut and style my hair any way they liked.  No one wanted to take the first cut so one of the trainers was like give me that and took the sissors and cut my pony tail, after that the girls had a field day...mullet, mohawk and all kinds of crazy hair styles, then my coworker gave me a military buzz cut.  I had the military buzz cut for 2 weeks before the hair started to fall out, I would pull out the hair making designs and pattern on my head...irrated the crap out of my sister.  I think for about a month I looked like a monk the only hair left was a bowl on top of my head..agian it irrated my sister...I finally gave in and let her shave the rest of the head off...it made her day... The wig lasted all of 2 hours for me..I just went bald...
Posts.Title: How did you deal with losing your hair? taraw413 lorenar

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2011 10:38PM hydeskate wrote: I work on daily basis with 200+ college athletes, I had Chemo in the morning at work in the afternoon getting them ready for practices and games my first round with Abraxane.  I took the day of treatment off with AC just becasue the soccer season was over and I felt like goof off the rest of the day,  did the same thing the 2nd round with Abraxane I was still getting paid so I was like what the hey. I was lucky that I had no symptons until the Pharmist wanted to see how much I could take, so she jacked up the dosage the 2nd round of Abraxane to see how long before I felt something, finally started to get tingling in my fingers so she had to dial it back. I even went on a road trip from North Carolina to Alabama to our Bowl Game with my sister between my third and fourth treatment of AC.  Being a control freak and it was my car I drove all the way, only problem was I didn't eat enough before going to the game so we ended up leaving in the 3rd quarter and went to get a Steak at the Sports Bar and finished watching the game there.  What I did was listen to my body, and lucky my work was flexiable, I didn't set an alarm just got up when my body said to and went to bed when it said.  Biggest thing was make sure I didn't cramp that was the big problem I had, gatorade and baked potates became my best friend.  Also kept foods like tuna, next to my bed, I would wake up starving a little bit of food and I was back out.
Posts.Title: Chemo and working TAPPY TAPPY

Posts.Content: May 21, 2011 12:42PM hydeskate wrote: I got t the same thing when I had AC, when I got sleepy my face and neck turned red and warm thought I had a fever but temp was normal.

Posts.Content: May 21, 2011 01:40PM hydeskate wrote: I didn't get sick at all on AC, just got red face/neck when I got sleepy.  I was back to work the next morning after my treatment.

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2011 05:16PM hydeskate wrote: Speaking of bald, I tried a wig it lasted about 3 hours.  I started treatment during the summer and the wigs just itched and made me over heat.  I went bald, occansionally wore hats especially when working soccer games outside or when going shopping got really cold in some stores with the AC blowing down on your head.  The athlete's and my co workers were like good thing you have the right shaped head to pull off the bald look. I let the athletes paint my head for game days they would also rub the head before they took the field for luck. I also let the w soccer team shave my head before I started Chemo, they got to try out different hair cuts took pics before my co worker gave me the military buzz cut.
Posts.Title: Chemo and working TAPPY TAPPY

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2011 11:44AM hydeskate wrote: I dreaded the test when my mom tested postive, my sister tested negative, I think deep down I new I had the gene.  I got the test after injurying my breast, they thought the lump was a hemotoma becasue it didn't act like a tumor.  I got my Brac 1+ test the same day I was dx with Stage IV breast cancer at age 29.  Needless to say all the relatives that had refused to get the test got the test, there is still a few holdouts.  With cancer age doesn't matter, becasue I am young I have been able to handle the treatment with really no side effects, and currently I am NED for the past 18 months.
Posts.Title: Any BRCA+ women here? Rachel1 elmcity69

Posts.Content: Jun 9, 2012 09:13AM hydeskate wrote: i refused to take the compazine, after I took it as instructed even though I was feeling fine after my first treatment, and about 30 minutes later I was throwing up.  I stopped taking them and I had no more nasuea and made it thur both Abraxane twice and AC with only sinus infections.  I was prescribed like 3 or 4 pills don't remember all the names didn't take any of them. I also got nauseated due to lack of food, so I always made sure to have snacks through out the day, and at night a bottle of gatorade and snack on the nightstand. I had body aches in after the first one mentioned to the Athletic Trainers at work the said it sounded like low potassium and told me to drink gatorade and eat banana's and potatoes, they were correct didn't have that problem any more. Hair wise mine started to grow back with AC, I had Abraxane before taking the AC that made me almost bald, I had hair on the crown of my head that reminded my sister of Budda Monks.  I kept it for awhile cause it made my sister crazy becasue she wanted to shave it....Finally let her she ran as quick as possible to gas station for shaving cream and a pack of razors.
Posts.Title: A/C Chemo - any tips? allisontom911 banjobanjo

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2012 04:22PM hydeskate wrote: I was young but just out of college when my mom passed away from Stage IV Ovarian.  She had started packed trunks for both me and my sister with stuff from our childhood and she had hand notes attached for example a doll that was given to me by my aunt, I have that little note on my bullention board. She was sort of a pack rat she litteraly had every single report card including college, pictures we had made.  She had started working on pictures, writing the names on the back especially the older one's so me and my sister show to future generations.  She was the official family photographer, everything was document (large family on both sides), we are talking over 1,000 pictures.  As we have free time my sister and I sort and scan the pics putting them online, a little trip down memory lane.  I wasn't sure how everyone would react but it actually turned at good, in turn my other cousins started getting photo's from there parents and uploading them as well.  Pictures can speak a thousands words, even a simple note or card.
Posts.Title: What should I be doing for my young children 4myangels momto2angels

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2013 07:01PM hydeskate wrote: I was dx 2008 Stage IV out of the gate with mets to Liver and lungs. Been NED and on a chemo Holiday since Oct 2009, currently just started taking methotraxte to treat my other problem Sjogren's Syndrome caused by my defective immune system which is a risk since the drug can damage my liver so I get tested even more tests.
Posts.Title: liver mets - are you out there? Huntsco Mamita49

Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2012 08:06AM hydeskate wrote: I was dx in 2008 with Stage IV TNBC Mets to liver and lungs.  My left lung was covered in small nodules and really glowed on the CT Scan, I had some spots in right lung and had several spots the size of quarters, dimes and eraser heads on my liver.  The only thing my Doctors said was we can't wait for Duke any more who was suppose to be looking at my case to see if I qualified for whatever Clinical Trial they had going on. They straight up said we have no idea what they were going to do and would be written the protocl as they went along becasue you weren't suppose to be 29 with Stage IV.  My Onc said her plan was to see me at 80 rocking on the front porch.  Its now 2012 I have been NED and off Chemo since 2009, I get scaned every 3 months.  The only thing I am battling and hopefully just got undercontrol is my Sjogren's Syndrome that was dx after I got off chemo, it took a while but it seems we finally got the right combo of meds for the pain and inflammation.

Posts.Content: May 24, 2011 07:17PM hydeskate wrote: I too have found reading books as an escape, also watching movies, working on varius hobby/projects and playing video games.
Posts.Title: how to live jleigh jleigh

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2012 07:45PM hydeskate wrote: Michelle, I am Triple Negative as well right out of the gate with Stage IV mets to liver and lungs in 2008.  I had Abraxane X 2, AC along with radiation and BMX that has put me in NED (no evidence of disease) since Oct. 2009.  I remember those first couple of months not sure of what is going on or what was going to happen.  I have learned to keep myself busy, thankfully I have a job I love and I can still work fulltime which helps to keep those cancer thoughts at bay.  I currently get scanned every 3 monts, next scan suppose to be Dec. 3rd.

Posts.Title: 28 YR Old Is Looking For Support from You wwaterlilyy ibcmets

Posts.Content: May 18, 2011 08:23AM hydeskate wrote: I told my family,coworkers and then the athletes I work with on a daily basis.  Needless to say all the athletes knew in under an hour after the first team was told.  There was no way I could hide it in the job I have, my counter parts across the country found before or at the annual convention that I missed. Funny thing is its going on 3 years since my dx and there is still some people in the department that didn't know I was Stage IV even after the department released a story on the web and then the local paper released another one.
Posts.Title: how many people have you told apple blondiex46

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2012 05:21AM hydeskate wrote: I was dx @ stage IV in FEB 08 did Abraxane every 3 weeks, which cleared up all the METS in my left lung and all but the quarter size spot on liver, they switched me to AC with the same schedule, after that I was scaned and they planed to cyber knife the liver spot but got a shock when they looked at the scan it was gone, so they moved on to a BMX, then Radiation, scans keep coming by clean then they decided for the Hell of it give me Abraxane at the highest dose possible due to me only having sinus infection the first time around, finished it in OCT 09. Scans where clear again so they decided to give me a Chemo break, that was 2.5 years ago and I have the aggressive Triple Negative and BRAC 1 +.  I get scaned or x-rayed every 3 months, alone problems I am having is a combination of the effects from the treatment and the autoimmune disorder that decided to activate after Chemo was finished, when I say I have inherited bad genes that is the understatement of the year.
Posts.Title: Stage IV-Can you go into remission, or be cured? amontro Landerson3237

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2012 07:41PM hydeskate wrote: I was dx with Stage IV out of the gate in 2008 with TNBC METS to lungs and livers @29.  I started Chemo in April 08 first Abraxane which got all the nodules in my lungs, and all but a quarter size spot in my Liver.  Switched in about mid Oct. 2008 to AC "red devil" finished it up right before Christmas, after Christmas I got scanned and my Dr. literally skipped down the hall to my room, they had checked it three times I was NED. That cleared the way for a BMX which I got in Feb 09, and according to the biopsy my ONC surgeon did showed the Chemo was effective in killing the cancer in my breast and my lymph nodes only showed trace evdience of cancer.  After surgery I had 31 days of Radaition in July, my scans were still NED, started Abraxane again in August 09 till October 09 my scan's were still NED so I was granted a Chemo Break.  It is now 2012 and I am still on a Chemo break, during this time I was dx with an auto immune disorder called Sjogren's Syndrome bascially my Immune System is attacking mositure organs, mouth, eyes, skin, funny thing I had no side effects on Chemo except sinus infections, now I have to deal with the residual effects of the Chemo & Surgery aches and pains, severe dry mouth, burning dry eyes, fatigue.  Thank-fully it looks like after 2 years we have finally got them undercontrol. I am just glad to have the extrem fatigue under control.  It is still hard to get up in the morning and I have a crap load of pills (10) to deal with mainly the Sjogren's and for the pain, but no Chemo.  I get scanned or chest x-ray every 3 months and email my ONC if any thing knew starts up so she can decided what to do.  The doctor's think that the Sjogren's is some how keeping the cancer at bay.  I am still working full-time but I am not sure how much longer I can handle it becasue of the amount of time just this past month I have close to 100 hours overtime by December it could be in an excess of 500 considering most days are 10 hours and some can be 15 but it is a fun job where there is down time to rest some.
Posts.Title: Can we start a thread of positive stories? Karen2012 nicole0714

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2012 12:03AM hydeskate wrote: I too was dx with Stage IV Triple Negative Breast Cancer out of the gate @ 29 that was 2008, 2 years to almost the day my mother died of Stage IV ovarian cancer, my left lung was covered with small nodules, my right lung had a few spots and I had numerus spots on my liver the largest the size of a quarter, and to top if all off I had the fast allergic reaction to taxol.  I had a choice to either pack it in or give a double bird, I choose the later. No way some damn cancer is taking me out with out a fight.  October is approaching which will mark 3 years since my last Chemo treatment and 3 years 10 months of being NED and have a bunch of experts at UNC Cancer Center and a leading TNBC doctor scratching their heads becasue I am suppose to be on Chemo the rest of my life.  My next scan is in December, the docs think that my Sjogren's Syndrome (auto immune disorder) is helping to keep the cancer at NED.
Posts.Title: Petrified...Stage IV with mets to the liver right out the gate aic GatorGal

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2012 10:34PM hydeskate wrote: I have TNBC BRAC1+ with liver and Lung Mets, dx 2008 @29, I have been on an extended Chemo break NED for 2+ years.  My left lung was completely concer with spots that too small to biopsy, I had several spots on liver the biggest being the size of a quarter which was the one they biopsied.  I was on Abraxane which wied out everything excet for the quarter size spot, switch to AC and was suppose to have cyber knife procedure on liver after finishing AC but when the scan came back NED Jan 2010.   Cyberknife canceled, bmx performed, followed by 31 days of radation, scans still clean, then another round of Abraxane for the Hell of it, still clean Oct 2010 doctor decided to give my body a break since I was stable, all scans since have been NED.  I get scaned every 3 months unless some pain comes up, I email my ONC and she decides if I need to come in to either get a scan or bloodwork.  I have had alot of scares over the years but it was caused by another genetic disease that was activated 3 months after chemo stopped an auto immune disorder Sjogren's Syndrome.  Next scan is scheduled for June but might be earlier, my auto immune disorder is flaring up some I am not sure if some of the extra pain I am having is associated with that or the Mets in the liver deciding to party.
Posts.Title: TNBC with liver mets Mel_H mkkjd60

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2012 04:04AM hydeskate wrote: I found the site after being given a couple weeks after I was rewarded a Chemo break from my ONC.  I am always on the computer but never actually thought about looking for Cancer forums, I was too busy with work trying to ignore the other part of my life that involved trips to UNC Cancer hospital every 3 weeks. I was dx 2008 with Stage IV out of the gate @ 29, two years after my mom passed of Ovarian Cancer, BRAC 1 positive, Triple Negative and allergic to Taxol.  Both my parents are from large very close families my mom's death hit them hard because she was the "matriarch" as us cousins called her she took over family dinners after Grandma passed (mom's side).  I made my sister tell the family after I text-ed her from the dr. office, needless to say I think it was a record setting grapevine who needed facebook..lol   Then had to go back to work and tell my boss, so by the end of that day the entire department as well as every school on tobaco road, and my counterparts from coast to coast knew.   Within two hours of the text 3 Uncles with a truck with trailer drove down to New Orleans where my sister was they packed her up in three hours and had her back in NC the next day.   It was kind of funny because I had 20 people following me around for three days as they ran all the scans and did more biopsy.  That and I felt like I was on Cheers, because every new my name because of where I worked,(that and I wore our school colors every day I went) in the Athletic Department at one of UNC rival schools,  I was lucky at the time that two other women had Stage IV, one being Coach Yow who would get updates from my boss and made a point to call me after Chemo to see how I was doing.  I have been luck to be off Chemo and Stable for 2.5 years, as I fight my newest battle Sjogren's Syndrome an autoimmune disorder.  Crossing my fingers that the scans don't show any serious problems with my liver which hasn't been feeling right since my battle with Walking Pneumonia earlier this month.

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2012 09:03PM hydeskate wrote: I was dx Stage IV out of the gate with liver & lung Mets in 2008.  2 years of Chemo, a month of rads and bilateral Mastecomy and I have been NED (no evidence of disease) since october 09 (my count).  The doctors at UNC Docs have been counting since my first NED Scan in Dec 08, so 3 year chemo free holiday... Mets is basically chronic disease that is treatable and everyone will respond different to treatment.  Here is hoping that your mom's doctor's will find the right combo to wipe out/control those liver mets.

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2012 07:34AM hydeskate wrote: I was Stage IV at the start @29, and my doctor's bascially said your not suppose to be young and Stage IV, and that there really isn't a protcol so we are basically going to have to make one up as we go along, and I am at Cancer Hospital that actually specializes in my type which is Triple Negative.
Posts.Title: I thought this was supposed to be rare 4myangels carpe_diem

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2011 03:40AM hydeskate wrote: I don't think the Staging really has anything to do with SE or tolerance of Chemo, it is just how ones body reacts to the Chemo.  I didn't have any side effects on  two rounds of Abraxane and one round of AC, except for the hais loss and sinus infections, but I am still having them after being off Chemo for 2+ years, so they think it was actually the auto immune disorder they just dx.  I did have some finger tingling of the hands after the Pharmacist decided on round 2 of Abraxane to put the dosage at the highest possible until I showed  SE, I made half way thru the treatments before it started to get tingling.   Funny thing is now that I am off Chemo, I am dealing with swollen joints and pain now but that is due to Sjogren's Syndrome which I tested positive for this summer. Alot of the SE to this is the same as some of the listed side effects of Chemo which we are managing with pain pills and muscle relaxers.  My doctors are scratching there collective heads because they can't explain why I have been NED for so long. There is a drug I can take to get rid of the majority of my symptoms but that would suppress the very confused immune system that seems to be denying the cancer cells  from dividing.
Posts.Title: Early stage vs stage 4 chemo WifeandMom KSkier

Posts.Title: Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2012 08:20PM hydeskate wrote: I see mine every 3 months, only becasue I am good about emailing her any problems, if it raises a flag she makes me come to get it checked.  I get either a CT Scan or Chest X-ray every three months.
Posts.Title: Almost a month here... lisalock lisalock

Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2012 09:02AM hydeskate wrote: I am taking Plaquneil, it helps decrease the joint pain, swelling and keep the Sjogren's somewhat undercontrol.  At first my ONC didn't want me to take it cause she thought it would oppress my immune system, which she didn't want because she thinks my immune system is keeping the cancer in check, but the Plaquneil doesn't supress it interferes with communication between the cells in the immune system. It also takes over a month or two of taking the drug before it really starts to work.
Posts.Title: What do you make of the miracle stories? Skream DivineMrsM

Posts.Content: May 20, 2011 11:53PM hydeskate wrote: I got a power port when I was dx (@29) and its worked great.  Only problem I had was the one time I got the clueless nurse who didn't know how to access a port, once she finally got in and took my blood the dummy took it out and I had chemo next....needless to say I never let her touch my port again.   The one thing I found with my self is,  if I was hydrated the port would be sluggish, I had to make sure I was well hydrated before I got blood drawn or chemo.
Posts.Title: new member with question LindaVA spouse1

Posts.Content: May 8, 2013 02:48PM hydeskate wrote: I was dx stage IV out of the gate @ 29 in 2008 with triple negative, I have been NED since Oct 2009 and off chemo.  Every year my ONC/GYN who is the one that found the breast cancer asks me when am I going to have a kid, so I think it is possible.  You just need to weigh all the options with me I also have an autoimmune issue and there is the 50/50 chance any kid I have will inherit the BRAC 1 gene.  This is a big concern in terms of my family since both my mom & aunt had breast cancer in there 20's and died of ovarian in there 50's.  On top of that another aunt and a cousin where dx with Triple Negative right after me.  I know if I choose to have a kid my sister (who droped everything in Lousianna and moved back to NC when I was dx) along with my cousins would take care of my child if I passed on.

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2012 06:35AM hydeskate wrote: I didn't get to aviod any treatments either, becasue of my age, the Drs. decided they where going to throw everything including the kitchen sink at the cancer.  So far their little experiment has helped, along with some help from my screwed up genes I inherited, including the lovely Brac 1 gene.
Posts.Title: I thought this was supposed to be rare 4myangels carpe_diem

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2012 05:33PM hydeskate wrote: It was recommend by the genetics that are entire family get tested, some did some like me procrastinated, until the knot, found out on the same day that I had Stage IV and Brac 1 postitive.  It scared the shit out of the rest of my cousins and aunt's who then got tested. Two of my cousins so far tested postivie one of them is my double first cousin and the doctor's immediately performerd a mamogram, CT Scan and several other test to get a baseline.  They actually want to see her every 6 monthes but she can't afford it, being a single mom with 2 kids.  The consider her a very high risk becasue she is a close as you can get without being sisters.
Posts.Title: Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2013 11:45PM hydeskate wrote: I was dx out of the gate with liver mets in 2008, somehow Abraxane and AC red devil where able to zap the dozen spots that showed up on the CT scan when I was dx.  After 16 months of chemo I was granted a chemo holiday after having 3 consecutive NED scans (I was scanned every 3 months) in Oct 2009.  I was told it would be short, yeah almost 4 years later NED and no chemo.   Next scan will be this November. My Cancer may be  under-control  but my Immune System is a different story....it on the fritz, haywire, deadly computer virus...basically way out of control.  Shortly after getting off Chemo,  I got dx with an autoimmune disorder Sjogren's, which is attacking healthy cells and doctors believe somehow it is keeping the cancer in line.  Apparently the cancer was the easy problem to solve the immune system entirely different ball of wax, this is my last option to get the inflammation and pain under-control and its not looking good.  The drug is great (Methroxate) it has gotten the majority of my problems under-control, the problem is it appears I may be allergic.  I stooped taking it after a rash appeared, it has slowly cleared up, so we are going to restart and see what happens.  If the rash reappears then we will have conformation that I am allergic, which in turn means I am screwed, not a good sign when your ONC states "We will be in trouble if you are allergic"...ugh Praying everyone else will have success on their treatments and hopefully you will get to hangout with Stable or NED for an extened stay.
Posts.Title: How are people with liver mets doing? blondie1 JFL

Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2015 02:36AM hydeskate wrote: Still on NED and on a Chemo Holiday for my cancer since Oct 2009 (dx 2008 Stage IV METs to Liver and lungs). I am also fighting an Auto Immune Disorder called Sjogren's, In a nut shell when my immune system came back on after Chemo (Oct 2010) it was defective and began attacking healthy cells particularly moisture making ones like eyes, mouth, skin, lungs, liver, kidneys, etc. We have been fighting to get the Immune system under control, without using medicines that will suppress my immune system cause my Oncologist is afraid if we suppress the Cancer will come back. The Oncologist are have been theorizing that the Sjogren's is some how keeping the cancer under-control. To be honest for me fighting the cancer was allot easier since I had no side effects from all the chemo. Now I am not on Chemo and basically have all the side effects listed as side-effects of the Chemo's I took. After 2 years my immune system was still spiraling out of control, I was having extreme fatigue, swollen partoid glands, walking pneumonia, so my Oncologist approved me to start on Methoxrate. It helped some but not enough since April 2014 I have been going to the eye doctor every freaking month, I have had bacterial conjunctivitis every other month, inflammation of the cornea, also had a scratch on my cornea and about every other possible thing. I have no tears which means severely dry eyes to the point of Photo-phobia, my eyes are sensitive to light from indoor to outdoor, most of the times I have to wear shades. I have figured out that Predisnoe stops the inflammation of my eyes allowng me to go without the shades, but my Rheumatologist doesn't want to give it too me long term.. Even though almost everyone in my family has been taking it for decades. My oncologist agrees with me on the Prednisone but convincing my rheumatologist is another thing, i got a month's worth out of him for December, and the month has been great, I have energy, can go outside with no shades. But as I figured it has been almost a week off and my eyes are inflamed once more, and the fatigue is coming back with a vegenance.
Posts.Title: How are people with liver mets doing? blondie1 JFL

Posts.Content: May 24, 2013 10:24PM hydeskate wrote: I was told October 2009 after 18 months of Chemo that my body needed a rest and since my scans for 10 months showed No evidence of Disease this was the best time.   I was told that it was more than likely going to be a short break since I have Triple Negative.  Yeah well that short break has turned into 3+ years of no chemo, the only explanation the doc's have come up with is that my faulty immune system that came back online activating an autoimmune disorder that is attacking mositure making organs & joints is somehow keeping the cancer in check. So there is some hope and we are currently testing the theroy of my immune system keeping the cancer at bay, my immune system is currently being suppressed for a month in an attempt to curve damaged to the joints in my hands.......
Posts.Title: For those of you who have taken chemo breaks lotusblossom hydeskate

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2012 05:06PM hydeskate wrote: Well I have a first person story, I was dx in 2008 @ 29 with Stage IV Triple Negative Breast Cancer with METs in my Liver and my left long was bright covered with small nodules.  I am also BRAC 1 postive. I had agressive Chemo Abraxane (Stand Alone) followed by AC (red devil), surgery BMX, then Radation followed by Abraxane again but at a higher doseage, pharmist wanted to see who much I could take before having side effects didn't really have any except for a sinus infection.  By Jan 09 my first NED scan, making the docs more comfortable performing BMX, which was suppose to be followed by more Chemo, but I had an infection that hospitalized me so I was switched to Radation.  After Radation I went back on Chemo, scans where still NED.  Oct 2009 was my last Chemo. Mircacle? Not really when my immune system came back on it activated another inherited disease called Sjogren's Syndrome.  Bascially my immune system is attacking heathly cells in moisture making glands.  I have dry mouth, throat, nose, it is also attacking my joints, and it looks like its going after my digestive system right now, my ONC has sent me over to the GI Clinic.  Though I am not on chemo I basically have all the side effects and spend about $300 bucks a month on arthritis, pain pills, pill that is suppose to make salvia, and a drug used for Malaria that is suppose to help with the joint pain.  I get scanned every 3 months and any new issues I email my ONC. My Onc thinks the immune system is keeping the cancer in check, I was told that autoimmune disorders has been know to "cure" some cancer's like Melnomia but not breast cancer (my onc works with Melnomia cancer too).  I also read an article recently where doctors used a dead HIV virus into a child with Leukemia and it put her into remission, something about the T-cells. A 2nd hand story is that both my mom and aunt had breast cancer @ 29, my Aunt Stage IV, mom not sure cause she lied to the family only my dad knew it was cancer, she claimed it was beign.  I still want to know how much the boob job cost becasue you couldn't tell it was fake......Both would die in their 50's from Ovarian Cancer.
Posts.Title: What do you make of the miracle stories? Skream DivineMrsM

Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2011 08:02PM hydeskate wrote: I too was dx early 08 with Stage IV right out of the gates with mets to liver & lungs, after chemo scans showed I was NED, so docs cleared me to have a bmx in Feb 09 then had radation followed by another around of Chemo, so I have been NED around~3yrs.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy at stage IV? Romans8 ibcmets

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2013 06:44AM hydeskate wrote: Actually my hair started growing back when I switched from Abraxane to Adriamycin.
Posts.Title: changing to adriamycin - thoughts? stadown hydeskate

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2016 08:37AM hydeskate wrote: It has been a while since I checked in, still NED and still on vacation from Chemo for my cancer (I began my "short break" Oct 2009) and still getting my butt kicked by Sjogren's an autoimmune disorder that went ape sh** when my immune system came back online. I am taking wouldn't you guess an older chemo drug called Methotexate in a low dosage to keep my white blood counts low to curb the damage. Lately I have been sleeping more than awake but I have no pain which is important for me, not so cool part is I love the sun and beach but due to the Sjogren's those days are long gone. I am literally and figuratively allergic to the sun, LED lights which sucks since everyone and every place uses them, I have to wear sunglasses everywhere, cause lights hurt my eyes to the point of up chucking, I can also get burns from sun and some uv lights. Have to lower light on computer especially with white backgrounds like Word, Excel and this website. The dreaded 3 month return visit to the cancer hospital is fast approaching where I get to find out if my long unexpected ride with Mr. Ned has ended or my love affair will continue. Part of me would rather go back on chemo because no immune system means no more relentless attacks from my immune system. My joints, glands, eyes, muscles, mouth, skin, vein's, digestive system, kidneys, liver and well basically anything that is moisture making. Also have Fibromaligia, Raynauds, Varicose Veins, and other stuff that I can't remember. On a crazy amount of drugs all having possible interactions if mixed together it is a crazy cocktail we seemed to have got the right combo at the moment. My biggest issue is extreme fatigue, doesn't help that may cause drowsiness on all my drugs. I think I am up too like 6 Specialist Doctor's, the biggest pain is the doctor appointments, before I went on Disability from work I was only 20 minutes from the Cancer Hospital but now its 2 hrs away. They long trip takes all my energy from the entire month, which is how long it takes to recover from each trip.
Posts.Title: Triple Negative Stage IV Renae64 thrivingmama

Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2012 09:22PM hydeskate wrote: I had no symptons on both Abraxane and AC started April 2008 finished AC after Christmas, was schuedled for cyberknife for liver until the scan of my liver came back NED, so we skipped that went to BMX, then Radiaiton and Abraxane again for the hell of it, I was still NED that jacked the doseage higher than what they gave me the first time, half way thru I started getting tingling in fingers, so the pharmacist dialed it back.  My last chemo was Oct. 2009, I get a chest x-ray or CT Scan every 3 months.  Any issues new pains I email my ONC and she decides if I have to need to come in to get checked. I am knocking at 4 years this December being NED with Triple Negative without Chemo, I just take meds for pain and for an autoimmune disorder that I developed after my immune system came back online. No side effects doesn't mean its not working, I also refused to take those pre meds, and post meds, only thing I took was the pain pills.  I also worked full-time job that is 365 days 10+ hours 9 months out of the year, luckily I have a job that people would kill for, spend lots of someone else's money, get paid to watch sports, did I mention spending someone elses money, it also helped I was like the 8th person to have cancer and like the 5th to be Stage IV at work so they where use to make accomodations.
Posts.Title: Studies that show that "aggressive" chemo prolongs life? LizLemon JeninMichigan

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2014 01:00AM hydeskate wrote: I was dx out of the gate in 2008 with TNBC with Mets to my liver and lungs there were several spots in my liver and my lungs were covered with nodules.  I was allergic to Taxol so I was put on Abraxane, then AC, got my first NED scan that allowed me to go ahead and have my BMX then  Radiation, Abraxane again even though I was still NED, then Exchange surgery.  I have been off chemo for cancer since Oct 2009, summer of 2010 they thought cancer was back but they instead discovered my immune system came back onlne defective I had Sjogren's Syndrome my immune system is attacking healthy cells,   Won the first round with cancer, and get the crap kicked out of me by a stupid auto immune disorder, had to start a Chemo drug Methoxrate this pass June in hopes it gets the Sjogren's Under-control its not working or it is and the cancer is back......guess we will find out at the end of Jan.

Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed :( loving_mother nwest125

Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2012 04:29PM hydeskate wrote: I was dx in 2008 out of the gate with Stage IV Triple Negative Brac 1 + @ 29 and was treated aggresively and had bmx after 2 rounds of Chemo then had rads followed by another round of Chemo (abraxane) for the Hell of it at higher dose until I had symptons (had no symptons with the 1st round of Abraxane or AC that I had next).  I had mets that covered my entire left lung, few nodules in right lung and spots all over my liver.  The doctors basically said I was young and otherwise good health so they where "going to throw everything including the kitchen sinK" exact words my ONC said.   My last Chemo treatment was Oct 2009, I have been NED since Dec 2008, I get either a chest x-ray or CT Scan every 3 months.  Any new issues I have I just email my ONC and she decides if I need to come in or not.  The bad news every screwed up gene in our family I got.... when my immune system came back on I was dx. with an autoimmune disorder Sjogren's Syndrome, my body is attacking moisture glands, so I got all the symptons of Chemo without the chemo.  Next CT Scan is t-minus 2.5 weeks and scan aniety in full force especailly since the liver is feeling a little odd and sluggish.
Posts.Title: Studies that show that "aggressive" chemo prolongs life? LizLemon JeninMichigan

Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2015 12:47AM - edited Jan 3, 2015 01:05AM by hydeskate I found my lump Dec 2007 by Feb 2008 I was told I had Stage IV Triple Negative with Mets to my liver (over a dozen spots largest the size of a quarter), and lungs (my entire left lung glowed brightly on the CT scan and had a few spots in my right). Chemo #1 Abraxane, Chemo #2 A/C, first NED scan, Surgery (Bilateral Mastectomy), Radiation, 2nd NED Scan,, Chemo #3 Abraxane again, Oct 2009 3rd NED scan. Doctors decided to give my body a break, and Grant me a Chemo break, I was told it would be short lived since I was Triple Negative, yeah it is 2015, the beginning of my 7th year with Stage IV. I was dx in the Summer of 2010 with an Autoimmune Disorder called Sjogren's Syndrome, Fibromaylgia, Raynauds which has been a royal pain in my ass, the doctors believe that it is some how keeping the Cancer under-control but it is a double edge sword. All moisture making glands, in my body are dead or dying my partoid glands are always swollen, I have little to no saliva, I have Severe dry eyes,which has caused me to have Photo-phobia, (my eyes when inflamed can't stand any kind of light I wear shades the majority of the time), I have no sweat glands so I have issues with regulating hot and cold, Extreme Fatigue, Swollen Joints, my skin allerigic to water and the list goes on. I have been on Methotrexate an old Chemo drug since 2012 in a low dose in an attempt to keep the Sjogren's under-control, I also have to take Plaquenil,Gabapentin, and a crap load more pills, I had been working Full time through Chemo until I was slammed with the Sjogren's, my body was like nope not happening, so I went on Long Term Disability from work which has helped allot, was able to move back home and reconnect with my extended family. That and having your EMT/Registered Nurse Cousin living right next door comes in handy and retired Aunts and Uncles that love driving you the 2 hours to then Cancer Hospital/rheumatology clinic/eye clinic every month comes in handy. That and all the home cooked meals.
Posts.Title: Triple Negative Stage IV Renae64 thrivingmama

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2013 01:22PM hydeskate wrote: Angela-R Luckily I have an easy job that allows flexibility and is use to having employee's with Stage IV Breast Cancer, when I was dx there was 3 of us me being the baby of the group, sadly I am the one still kicking. If it wasn't for my sister no house work would get done, she moved back home with the help of one of our cousins.  I have to plan my day out in order to have enough energy to get things done, but I barley made it thru this past fall so I am not sure how much longer I can work full time, it isn't just full-time its 365 days, 7 days a week and can be up to 10+ hours during the athletic season.  Basically my life is sleep, work, doctor appointments, sleep, work, and a little computer time.  If I let myself I can litteraly sleep 14 hours every day but that usually equals more pain from inactivity. I am actually starting to look at disability since I qualify both with cancer and sjogren's.
Posts.Title: Triple Negative Stage IV Renae64 thrivingmama

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2013 10:29AM - edited Feb 4, 2013 06:21PM by hydeskate Stage IV TNBC and Brac 1+, dx out of the gate in 2008 @ 29.  I have been NED since 2009 and I have been on a Chemo holiday since OCt 2009, I get scanned every 3 months.  That was the good news the bad after my immune system came back on line it activated an autoimmune disorder called Sjogren's, bacsically my immune system is attacking mositure making organs, I fell like I am on Chemo but I am not, dry mouth, nose and eyes, joint pain, fatigue, and now appears to be jacking around with my diegestive system. On another good note they think the Sjogren's is keeping the cancer in check.  I still have to take alot of medciation to keep the Sjogren's undercontrol but part of me wants the chemo back becasue that means no immune system which equals no sjogren's.
Posts.Title: Triple Negative Stage IV Renae64 thrivingmama

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2013 07:01PM hydeskate wrote: I actually had to go off on them and then refuse to answer any phone calls or text for a month and created a carebridge site and now a blog to update treatments for the family to cut down on the all the questions.  There was some flack in the beginning but now the family loves they get to know what is going on and I don't have to talk about it every 5 minutes.   I had one of my Aunt's come up to me after a Family get together to let me know she had been thinking about me and reads my blog/facebook/carebridge even though she doesn't comment.  I still get questions periodcially especially at work from some people that work in other buildings a rarely see me especially with it being the time for College Basketball pink games.

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2013 10:31PM hydeskate wrote: I would try and mix gatorade with water to keep hydrated, along with baked potatoes or banana's.  I got deyhrated when I first started taking Abraxane and got bad muscle spasms, I was telling some of my coworkers who happened to be athletic trainiers and she was like it sounds like your electrolytes are down, that is where the gatorade came in.  I keep a bottle of water and gatorade next to the bed along with tuna fish, don't ask I can't explain but I use to wake up at 4am hungry and the kitchen was down stairs.
Posts.Title: Floating, anyone else in the same boat? marywh SchnauzerMom

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2015 12:54AM hydeskate wrote: Josalive, I was dx out of the gate in 2008 with Stage IV Triple Negative Breast Cancer with Mets to Lymph Nodes, Liver and Lungs. After my first round of Abraxne shrunk my tumor and it wiped out everything except a spot the size of a quarter on my liver. The doctors decided to try Red Devil first then schedule Cyber Knife Surgery to zap that one spot on my liver. I never did the cyber knife cause the Red Devil got me to NED (no evidence of disease). Following the chemo, I got a double mastectomy, followed by radiation and for the heck of it another round of Abraxane. To this date I am still NED and have been on a extended chemo holiday since 2009, so anything is possible.

After chemo (abraxane), chemo (AC), surgeries, radaition, and more chemo (abrazane) for the hell of it, literally my scans had been clean since after the AC treatment and before surgery in Feb 09.  I have been NED (no evidence of disease) since October 2009 and I have been on an extended Chemo Holiday ever since, my doctors watch me like a hawk, I get scanned every 3 months rotation between CT and x-ray.  If I have any new pains I just email my ONC and she decides whether or not I need to come in for test.

Posts.Title: How long have you been Stage IV? goldie0827 dormouse

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2015 11:27PM - edited Feb 10, 2015 11:23AM by hydeskate I was dx with an autoimmune disorder called Sjogren's shortly after being granted a Chemo Holiday. I was dx Stage IV out of the gate in 2008 with mets to liver and lungs. While my oncologist and rheumatologist tried to figure out if it was Lupus, Sjogren's or both, the dermatologist determined I was allergic to water and also had Psoriasis and Eczema, possibly Rosacea that was 2010. This month the eye doctor confirmed the Rosaeca due to the inflammation I have in my lower eye lids, I also have severe dry eyes and mouth. Also have Fibromalagia, Raynauds and about a dozen other things I lost track a long time ago. They actually think my Sjogren's is know somehow keeping my cancer under control, after I started my chemo break Oct 2009 the Sjogren's has spiraled out of control and the cancer has taken a back seat with NED. I am taking Plaquenil, Methotrexate, Minnocycline, Flexeril, folic acid, Gabapentin, nexium, exvoac, Restasis and a few others. They have been playing around with the doseage of Methotrexate we just recently up it. Looking over my medical history I have had the Sjogren's since I was a baby but it didn't really start acting up till I moved from rural North Carolina to the city. I spent the majority of my college career in student health with repeated bouts of Walking Pneumonia, Bronchitis, Sinus infections every month, when I would go home to the coast I didn't get sick. I just recently moved back to the coast and rural North Carolina which has helped tremendously with sinus and allergies. The bad thing is a 200 round trip 2 to 3 times a month to see my Specialist Doctors.

My last Chemo treatment was Oct 2009, my last three scans had come back clean , so the doc's said I could have a break, I get scaned/x-ray every 3 months. I also was recently dx with Sjogren's Syndrome, currently waiting on results of my Bone Scan, to determine if the pain I have been having is Arthritis or Bone Mets.  The blood test came back good as well as my liver function test.

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2013 01:37PM hydeskate wrote: I have Stage IV Triple Negative and I have been NED (No evidence of Disease) since Jan 2009, my last Chemo was in Oct 2009.  I have been on a Chemo Holiday every since, my ONC told me I would most likely have a short break due to triple negative being aggressive but instead we are pushing 4 years NED. Shortly after the chemo holiday started I was dx with Sjogren's Syndrome an autoimmune disorder, the doctor's think this may be helping to keep the cancer in check.
Posts.Title: Anyone stage IV TN and in remission? debbiej MothersDaughterTNBC

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2015 02:15AM hydeskate wrote: Mets to the liver doesn't mean the end is near, I was dx out of the gate in 2008 with Stage IV TNBC with Mets to my Liver and lungs by my count 2015 is the beginning of my 8th year. My liver had over a dozen spots ranging from the size of a pin head to a quarter, My first round of chemo was with Abraxane that zapped all of them except the stubborn quarter size spot, and got all the spots in my lungs, the doctor's decided to throw another chemo AC at it then they plan was to go after the spot with Cyberknife. After finishing the AC I got my first NED Scan (no evidence of disease) so the cyberknife was canceled, I proceeded to have my double mastectomy then radiation to my left chest (where my primary tumor was) after that I had another round of Abraxane for the hell of it according to my Doctor. I was still NED after that round of Chemo and was given a break from Chemo that I was told was going to be short that was Oct 2009. Chemo Holiday has been a blessing although the battle with cancer was a trigger for another disease that for the most part had been doormat called Sjogren's (Auto Immune Disorder). I apparently I hit the genetic lottery of all the crappy genes in my family my mom's side a genetic defect Brac 1 and Ovarian, Breast and Bladder cancer and both sides of the family tree are littered with Auto Immune Disorders. The last year I have been taken low doses of Methotrexate which is an old chemo to treat the Sjogren's.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with Liver cancer Scrappygrl Scrappygrl
